abstract: The deal, worth up to $632 million, is part of Pfizer’s effort to keep up with rivals that are increasingly relying on biotechnology for products and profits.
snippet: The deal, worth up to $632 million, is part of Pfizer’s effort to keep up with rivals that are increasingly relying on biotechnology for products and profits.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer, the world’s largest drug company, has agreed to pay up to $632 million to Theraclone Sciences in a research collaboration on antibody drugs for cancer and infectious disease, the companies said Tuesday.

headline.main: Pfizer in Deal With Theraclone for Antibody Drug Research
headline.print_headline: Pfizer in Deal With Theraclone for Antibody Drug Research
